definition: to officially end a law, a system or an institution
a person that somebody is opposed to and competing with in an argument or a battle
a thing that you can choose to do or have out of two or more possibilities
weapons, especially as used by the army, navy, etc.
a slip of paper used to register a vote
to have sth as a main or basic part
to gain a further advantage for yourself from a situation
individual and collective actions designed to indentify and address issues of public concern
a status hierarchy in which individuals and groups are classifed on the basis of economic success and accumulation of wealth
property or something valuable that you promise to give to somebody if you cannot pay back money that you borrow
sth you have done to be criticized severely for sth you have done
the benefit or interests of all
shared by, or for the use of, a number of people, especially people who live together
a district that elects its own representative to parliament
an area of land that has or used to have its own government and laws
sth is available to be used by everyone
the way that something is spread or exists over a particular area or among a particular group of people
to make leadership become more varied
euphemism for deceitful, whether by volunteering false information
based on, or holding, the belief that everyone is equal and should have the same rights and opportunities
the people in a country or an area who have the right to vote, thought of as a group
